posts.author: grom
posts.content:
I was wondering.... Would it be helpful (to anyone other then me!) to have some sort of listing of the more common abbreviations used in builds?

I know I tend to get lost reading some of the builds and replies to questions about builds when the shorthand starts flying fast and wild. Though, those who know me, know it's not just the abbreviations that get me lost!!

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
It would help me as well, grom.

I still remember languishing for days (years ago) over a reference of someone taking "MM" only to find out it meant Magic Missile.

posts.author: Devlinor
posts.content: Think that this might be a good idea. Many new folk that do come here will not know what we are talking about, otherwise.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Here is a start, freshly-stolen from the NWNwiki's table of acronyms, filtered, amended and reformatted (blasted tabs!). It a starting point so pitch in ya'll!

Note: Because I haven't figured out how make columns on these posting boards, I tried unsuccessfully to attach the source document (well, it said it attached but after it was submitted it went *poof* ) so am holding the list in fixed font on a file on this machine.

Code: Select all

AA        arcane archer (prestige class) 
AB        attack bonus 
AC        armor class 
AoE       area of effect 
APR       attacks per round 
BAB       base attack bonus 
BBoD      black blade of disaster (spell) 
BG        blackguard (prestige class)
CC        custom content or community content 
CEP       Community Expansion Pack 
CHA       charisma (ability) 
Clr       cleric (class) 
CON       constitution (ability) 
CoT       champion of Torm (prestige class) 
CR        challenge rating 
Crit      critical hit 
CS        called shot (feat); not to be confused with "Counter-Strike". 
DA        death attack (feat); a special ability of the assassin, similar to sneak attack. 
DC        difficulty class 
DEX       dexterity (ability) 
DM        Dungeon Master 
DnD       Dungeons & Dragons, Pen-and-paper role playing game the basis of Neverwinter Nights. 
DP        divine power (spell) 
DR        damage reduction or damage resistance 
Dru       druid (class)
dump      to allocate a large amount of saved skillpoints at a single level-up 
DW        dual-wield (either as a character description or the feat)
DwD       dwarven defender (prestige class) 
EBT       Evard's black tentacles (spell) 
ECL       effective character level 
EDR       epic damage reduction (feat) 
EMA       epic mage armor
ER        elemental resistance 
ESF       epic skill focus (feat) 
ESF       epic spell focus (feat) 
EWF       epic weapon focus (feat) 
EBT       Evard's black tentacles (spell) 
EWS       epic weapon specialization (feat) 
Fort      fortitude (saving throw) 
FP        full plate (armor) 
Ftr       fighter (class) 
GMW       greater magic weapon (spell) 
GS        greater sanctuary (spell) 
HD        hit dice 
HiPS      hide in plain sight (feat) 
HLA       high level ability 
HotU      Hordes of the Underdark The second expansion pack,or just its campaign. 
HnS       hack & slash (game type) or H&S 
HP        hit points 
HS        Harper scout (prestige class) 
ID        improved disarm (feat) 
IGMS      Isaac's greater missile storm (spell) 
IKD       improved knockdown (feat) 
INT       intelligence (ability) 
KD        knockdown (feat) 
LMB       lesser mind blank (spell) 
lvl       level; class level, character level, dungeon level, monster level.
MD        Mordenkainen's disjunction (spell) 
Mod       module 
Mod       modification (custom content) Not often used by custom content 
          authors due to potential confusion with"module".
Mod       ability modifier 
MM        magic missile (spell) 
MMF       metamagic feats 
Mord      Mordenkainen's disjunction (spell) 
MP        multiplayer 
MS        move silently (skill) 
NEB       negative energy burst (spell) 
NPC       non-player character 
OC        original campaign; the first campaign that came with the game. 
PA        power attack (feat) 
pally     paladin (class) 
PC        player character 
PDK       purple dragon knight (prestige class) 
PGC       Pretty good character creator/converter 
PM        pale master (prestige class) 
PnP       pen and paper; players sitting around a table, throwing dice, 
          keeping track of the game on paper
PrC       prestige class; sometimes confused with PRC
PRC       Player Resource Consortium; sometimes confused with PrC 
PvE       player vs. environment; same as PvM 
PvM       player vs. monster; same as PvE 
PvP       player vs. player (i.e. dueling) 
PW        persistent world 
RDD       red dragon disciple (prestige class) 
Ref       reflex (saving throw) 
Rgr       ranger (class)
RL        real life 
Rog       rogue (class) 
RP        roleplay 
SD        shadowdancer (prestige class)
sneaks    sneak attacks (rogue attack against an enemy not in combat); also SA 
Sorc      sorcerer (class) 
SoU       Shadows of Undrentide; the first expansion pack, or just its campaign. 
SP        single-player
spam      to execute the same action repeatedly 
SR        spell resistance
ST        saving throw 
STR       strength (ability) 
TS        true seeing (spell or property) or true strike (arcane spell) 
TWF       two-weapon fighting (feat) 
UEF       undeath's eternal foe (spell) 
UMD       use magic device (skill) 
Vault     IGN Neverwinter Vault; a website for uploading/downloading custom content 
WIS       wisdom (ability) 
Wiz       wizard (class) 
WF        weapon focus (feat) 
WM        weapon master (prestige class) 
WP        weapon proficiency (feats) 
WS        weapon specialization (feat) 
WWA       whirlwind attack (feat) 
XP        experience points

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
HipMaestro wrote:Here is a start, freshly-stolen from the NWNwiki's table of acronyms, filtered, amended and reformatted (blasted tabs!). It a starting point so pitch in ya'll!

Note: Because I haven't figured out how make columns on these posting boards, I am attaching the document that was used to do the reformatting (oddly enough these boards would NOT allow me to attach either a .doc or a .txt file so I was forced to compress it). (Fixed font is only available by inserting text as code that scrolls.)
I haven't figured out how to make columns either, if anyone has the know how PM me. I'll check about the file attachment issue.


Regarding the acronyms you listed, some are odd (FP=full plate, HLA=high level ability), some have only one meaning associated while they are used for more (MM=Melee Magee too, CS= Crippling Strike too, DM= Dvine Might too etc.) and some are missing (DS=Divine Shield/Dragon Shape etc.), but I guess it's a good starting point.

Nice idea Grom! I'll look into the formatting issue and post it as a reference to all guild members in the Rules and Tools section.

posts.content:

A thief cannot be too choosy. He reaches in a drawer for valuables and just hopes the devious owner of the goodies didn't place a snake in there just for giggles.

Udahman, Kail!

I find this strange but passed it off as another of those browser issues. Just passing it along for if/when you decide to make edits yourself.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content: Would it beneficial to include the chat abbreviations (like IIRC, TBH, AFAIK, etc.) in this list or limit it to specifically character-building terms? I am thinking more of our foreign friends who may be scurrying for an English dictionary when terms like this show up in a post. And, TBH, occasionally I must scramble for a list of those myself when an unrecognizable one pops up in a forum post and the suspense is killing me.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content: I think a separate acronym list for typical forum/chat acronyms is better than putting the two together. Putting up one in a minute.

posts.content: Nice work Kail & Hip!! Both listings will come in very handy. Thanks to you both on such fast work!
